summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganOLAPLEX No.7 Bonding Hair Oil is a highly-concentrated, weightless reparative styling oil that dramatically increases shine, softness, and maintains color vibrancy. OLAPLEX N¬∞7 Bonding Hair Oil minimizes flyaways and frizz, while providing heat protection of up to 450¬∞F/232¬∞C.
details: DetailsBenefitsInstantly boosts shine, color vibrancy, and softness450¬∫F/232¬∫C heat protectionKey IngredientsPowered by: A blend of Coconut-Derived Emollient, Vitamin E, and Sunflower Seed Oil Conditions, smoothes, and provides shineResearch Results125% more shine*72 Hr frizz control and humidity resistance77% reduction in breakage450¬∞F/232¬∞C heat protection*Compared to bleached hair without application of OLAPLEX No.7 Bonding Oil‚Ñ¢.Item 2591018How To UseUncap and turn bottle upside down.Gently tap your index finger on the bottom of the bottle to dispense a metered drop.Apply 2-3 drops to damp or dry hair and style as desired.Can be used daily on wet and dry hair, before styling with heat, and after styling for added shine and smoothness.IngredientsDimethicone, Isohexadecane, C13-14 Isoparaffin, Coco-Caprylate, Phenyl Trimethicone, Bis-Aminopropyl Diglycol Dimaleate, Propanediol, Zea Mays (Corn) Oil, Beta-Carotene, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Moringa Oleifera Seed Oil, Punica Granatum Seed Oil, Water (Aqua/Eau), Morinda Citrifolia Fruit Powder, Fragrance (Parfum), Hexyl Cinnamal, Eclipta Prostrata Extract, Ethylhexyl Methoxycinnamate, Limonene, Tocopherol, Citral, Linalool, Melia Azadirachta Leaf Extract, Citronellol, Pseudozyma Epicola/Camellia Sinensis Seed Oil Ferment Extract Filtrate.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Uncap and turn bottle upside down.Gently tap your index finger on the bottom of the bottle to dispense a metered drop.Apply 2-3 drops to damp or dry hair and style as desired.Can be used daily on wet and dry hair, before styling with heat, and after styling for added shine and smoothness.
ingredients: Pseudozyma Epicola/Camellia Sinensis Seed Oil Ferment Extract Filtrate

reviews.headline: I love this product, there is no other!
reviews.comments: My favorite, I have tried replacing it with cheaper bonding oils, but nothing delivers the same results

reviews.headline: garbage
reviews.comments: I got this for free in a sample pack. I read the ingredients and I threw it in the trash. First is dimethicone... awful. it also has paraffin which is that nasty wax from candles. Few others that are terrible too. Don't put that garbage in your hair. I can't believe this "high end brand" would contain such trash. doesnt surprise me though, ive used sample packs of their shampoo and conditioner and my hair felt dry, and looked dull. My Matrix Mega Sleek is the best.

reviews.comments: Leaves a very nice sheen and hair looks healthy.

reviews.headline: Caution against the hype
reviews.comments: Poor overall experience. I have thick, wavy hair that has never been colored and bought this for heat protection/repair and overall hair health. I expected shine, softness and bounce - after using my hair feels dry, tangled, and dull. I've also noticed significant hair shedding since I started using regularly. Can't be sure if it's related, but this was an expensive mistake purchase for me.

reviews.headline: Adds shine!
reviews.comments: I love to use this oil on my second day hair, which always seems oily at the roots (for which I use dry shampoo or baby powder) but dull and dry on the ends.  I smooth it over the top layer and ends of my hair to restore that shine.

reviews.headline: I highly recommend this product  I love it
reviews.comments: Love using this product it does wonders

reviews.headline: Love it and works well
reviews.comments: I use this when my hair is damp and I love it so much, makes my hair soooo soft

reviews.headline: Little, powerful & goes a long way!
reviews.comments: Have been using this little gem for over a year now. It's pricey but it last a long time because you just need a few drops. I put it on my damp hair & it tames the frizz a lot & keeps my curls under control, as long as I don't fiddle too much with it. Smells nice, too! I love it!

reviews.headline: One of my hair Staples - But you need to know how to use it.
reviews.comments:
I have a lot of hair with a fine silky texture, and it's quite long. It can also get greasy and brittle if I strip it too much with washing. Because of this, I rarely wash my hair more than once a week. This bonding oil has done wonders for overall hair health and preventing damaged ends, as well as repairing damage already done. But you have to know how to use it. An oil like this should be applied toward the ends of your hair, immediately after showering while still damp. The oil seals the moisture in, so using it on dry hair doesn't have much of a benefit, and it's quite expensive. Even with almost waist length hair, this little bottle lasts me easily an entire year! I still use a serum on dry hair when I want those flyaways tamed, (Lanza Neem Plant Silk Serum is wonderful and I've been using the same bottle for a year and I'm not even halfway through it), and occasionally I'll use a leave in conditioner on the middle part of my hair, but only after applying Olaplex to the ends. 
The scent is very strong and sweet, almost like candy, and might be off putting to some. I don't have an issue with it, and it seems to fade relatively fast.

reviews.headline: This was great just not for me
reviews.comments: So i got this but i got it from ghe birthday gift duo.  I was so exited to use it because its pretty popular.  It just wasnt for me though. I have wavy hair and bad split ends so since it was a bonding oil i thought i use it for my split ends.  It did help with that but i dont really have a wavy hair routine so i just blow dry my hair and that helps straighten it out.  But when i blow dryed my hair with the oil in my hair after i was dont my hair looked stringy and greasy.  I gave the oil to my sister who does have a wavy hair routine and she said she loves it.  So long story short this is great if you have a curly or wavy hair routine.

reviews.headline: Didn"t work for me.
reviews.comments: I had been looking for a product to tame frizz, add shine, and smooth my hair. I read the reviews and did the questions to see what I needed.I guess the Olaplex No.7 oil works for a lot of people, but unfortunately I am one of the ones for whom it didnk't work. It made my hair very dry and it felt like straw. It made my hair look terrible. I did notice there were other reviewers who had the same experience. I just wish it hadn"t been recommended by Olaplex according to my question answers. I wish I hadn't spent the money.

reviews.headline: Awful scent
reviews.comments: The Olaplex line was recommended to me by a hairstylist so I bought several products‚Ä¶ and am returning most of them. The scent is nauseating to me. The fragrance smells cheap and overly sweet like a preteens perfume.

reviews.headline: Love this hair oil!
reviews.comments: I have wavy dry hair and this hair oil is  hydrating and makes your hair shiny and soft

reviews.headline: I love it
reviews.comments: I always find myself replenishing this product. I don't know why but always do I try other brands but always come back to this one. Great for all hair types. No complaints!!!

reviews.headline: Awesome product
reviews.comments: I will definitely recommend this for my curly hair friends

reviews.headline: Must have
reviews.comments: This product is amazing. It strengthens and repairs HAIR it boost shine, and it repairs damage and all HAIR types. It is my new go to HAIR OIL the only HAIR or I will ever use.

reviews.headline: Makes my hair feel so very soft!
reviews.comments: I have shoulder length hair. I use two drops and apply it to the lower part of my hair and brush through. The small bottle is going to last for a very long time!! Love it!

reviews.headline: Would not buy again
reviews.comments: I normally use Kerastase oil but decided to try Olaplex since Ulta doesn't sell the Kerastase oil.    The Olaplex oil was terrible for my hair.  I am 55, have wavy dyed hair.  The product did not have a good consistency and dried out my hair instantly.   It might be good for others with different types of hair, but not mine.  Definitely won't buy again

faceoff_positive.comments:
The search for that "holy grail" product is something we all experience, looking for that one product that we cannot live without.  As a 53 year old man who's tried plenty of hair oils over the years, Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil has really surprised me, and may be my "holy grail". I've used a variety of products, but this one stands out. Right from the start, I noticed how lightweight it is. Most oils I've used in the past tend to feel heavy or greasy, but this one absorbs incredibly quickly and doesn't leave any oily residue. I only need a few drops for my hair, and that's enough to make a difference without overdoing it.
What I really appreciate about this oil is the immediate improvement it brings. Just the simple fact of being older causes changes to your hair that you do not experience when you are in your 20's.  I have shoulder length hair, and although I do not color or treat my hair in any way, daily stressors and time still take a toll leaving it feeling dry and dull looking. But with Olaplex No. 7, I can see the difference right away. My hair is noticeably smoother, softer, and a lot shinier. It tames frizz easily and doesn't just make my hair look better, it feels better too. The softness and smoothness are clear signs that this oil is actually repairing some of the damage, and the results last for days, which I find simply amazing.  I also found that this oil assists in drying your hair faster and creating lots of soft touchable volume, even from air drying. 
Another thing that stands out to me is the scent. It's light and not overpowering, which is great since I prefer more subtle fragrances. I don't like hair products that linger too long with strong smells, and this one fades away quickly, leaving my hair smelling fresh but not overwhelming.
After using Olaplex No. 7 for a few months, it's earned a permanent place in my routine. Even at my age, having healthy-looking hair makes a difference, and this oil does the trick without needing to use a lot. A small amount goes a long way, which also makes it a great value. You just need to be careful not to overdo it, or your hair could look greasy. But when used right, the results are impressive. Plus, it's free of harsh ingredients like sulfates and parabens, which is important to me as I try to avoid unnecessary chemicals in my hair care products.
In short, Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil is a product I highly recommend.  I've seen the toll that time and treatments can take on hair, but this oil has helped restore softness, shine, and manageability. Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil has found a permanent place in my hair care routine.
"This review was collected as part of a promotion"
faceoff_positive.headline: Voluminous, Softer, Smoother Hair

faceoff_negative.comments: I've heard a lot of great things about Olaplex and was really excited to try the No. 7 Bonding Oil. My hair is sort of always in flux, currently it's thick, fine texture, and combo leaning towards an oily scalp with frizzy dry ends. I bleach and dye my hair with vibrant, rich colors and it's very important to me that I use products that not only are restorative and nutritious to my hair but also preserve and enhance vibrancy. I'm also shedding right now so if I don't care for it my hair is sorta breaking. Oils are one of my favorite products since they can be added at multiple steps and usually add a lot of ingredients that are very beneficial for hair preservation. I've been using the Olaplex No. 7 Bonding oil consistently for about two weeks, both on damp hair and dry. The scent is lovely and light, and I really enjoy the thoughtful bottle design. It's almost impossible to spill (have done with a few other products on accident), you do a few taps to the bottom while holding your hand underneath and a measured drop at a time pops out. The instructions recommend only a few drops, for chest length hair I feel a few more are needed. I'm sorry to say, but I was a bit disappointed by this hair oil and didn't feel it lived up to the hype. It always feels heavy sitting on my hair no matter how I use it or what products I pair it with, leading to an increase in the feeling of oiliness. It also doesn't add as much shine as I get from other oils. It's like it never penetrates the hair and just sits on top. I do think it helped somewhat with breakage and softening my hair, but didn't deliver on the other results it promises. I haven't noticed any significant long term results. I feel very mixed about it and probably wouldn't recommend unless you already have a full regimen of Olaplex products and can mix and match a bit more or know they work really well with your hair. I am grateful to have received this product for free from Olaplex.
faceoff_negative.headline: Mixed Results
